'''Sophie Turner''' (born 21 February 1996) is an English actress. She stars in [[HBO]]'s ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' as [[Sansa Stark]]. The show is her television debut. She was part of the initial starring cast and remains a member of the starring cast for the [[Season 2|second season]].

Regarding her character, Turner said in ''The Sunday Times'' before the Season 4 premiere:

:"She's relatable to because sheâ€™s such a realistic character...I think sheâ€™s like young girls today â€” they read magazines, they look at models, theyâ€™ve got social media telling them how to act. That's who Sansa is. She's looked at the queen, she's looked at Margaery Tyrell, and she idolises them. All she wants is to become them. Sheâ€™s like every 12-year-old girl who wants to be a celebrity â€” it's the same adolescence as everyone else, but a few hundred years ago. In an alternative universe. With dragons."<ref>[http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/culture/film_and_tv/article1389051.ece], [http://fyeahsophieturner.tumblr.com/post/80500246728/sophie-turner-interviewed-in-the-sunday-times-complete]</ref>

Turner actually has "naturally baby blonde hair", so her hair had to be dyed for Sansa's auburn (reddish brown) hair.<ref>[http://fashionista.com/2012/06/game-of-thrones-hair-and-wardrobe-secrets-revealed#3]</ref>  The Starks have black hair, while the Tullys have auburn hair, and Sansa is stated in the books to take after her mother Catelyn Tully in appearance.  When Sansa flees to the Vale with Littlefinger, she dyes her hair black to hide her true identity (corresponding to the end of Season 4 in the TV series).  

On January 23, 2015, is was confirmed by director Brian Singer that Sophie will appear in ''X-Men: Apocalypse'' (which is set in the 1980s) as young Jean Grey.<ref>http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/x_men_apocalypse/news/1932631/weekly_ketchup_x-men_apocalypse_finds_its_jean_grey_storm_and_cyclops/</ref>
